title: Internet goes crazy over Rod Stewart fixing potholes
description: "My Ferrari can't get through," so Rod Stewart fixes potholes himself. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Sleeping with even a small amount of light may harm your health, study says
description: Sleeping for only one night with a dim light, such as a TV set with the sound off, raised the blood sugar and heart rate of healthy young people participating in a sleep lab experiment, a new study found.

title: Ukraine steel plant at risk of emitting hazardous material if hit by bombs
description: A top steel company that employed nearly 40,000 people in Mariupol, Ukraine, was hit by shelling, forcing thousands of employees to live in bomb shelters, Metinvest CEO Yuriy Ryzhenko says. The plants can emit hazardous materials if they're hit by bombs while operating, forcing the company to strategize and decrease operations.

title: Here's how we know sanctions are hurting Russia
description: When the Communists and Vladimir Lenin took over Russia in 1917, they repudiated old czarist debts and the country defaulted on its foreign obligations -- the largest sovereign default in history.

title: Film director apologizes to Venus and Serena Williams for 'thoughtless' comment
description: Jane Campion, director of "The Power of the Dog," was championed on Twitter for her blunt response to Sam Elliot's criticism of her film. However, she faced criticism online 24 hours later for her "thoughtless" comments about Venus and Serena Williams at the Critics' Choice Awards.

title: Scientists in the US are flying planes into clouds to make it snow more
description: With 61% of the contiguous US in drought, wouldn't it be nice if we could just "make it rain" or just "make more snow?"

title: Why potassium iodide pills are suddenly in high demand
description: As Russia's assault in Ukraine intensifies, fear of radioactive fallout from accidental or intentional attacks on Ukraine's nuclear plants, or from the use of a nuclear bomb, has triggered surging demand for potassium iodide pills.

title: China expressing openness to military and financial aid for Russia, US cable suggests
A car was headed toward a 10K race. A trooper risked her life to protect the runners
description: Florida Highway Patrol Trooper Toni Schuck used her vehicle to block an alleged drunk driver from entering the route of a 10K race.

title: UN relief chief: 'Mariupol is the center of the hell we see in Ukraine'
description: Christiane Amanpour speaks with Martin Griffiths, the UN Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief Coordinator, on the growing humanitarian crisis in Ukraine

title: Fox News correspondent hospitalized after being injured in Ukraine
description: Fox News correspondent Benjamin Hall, who had been deployed in recent weeks to cover the war in Ukraine, has been hospitalized after being injured while reporting near Kyiv, the network said on Monday.

title: China has expressed some openness to providing military and financial aid to Russia, US cable suggests
Tesla's cruise control woes put damper on 'full self-driving' hopes
description: Ben Morris bought his Tesla in 2020 believing that it would drive itself one day. Now he says he would settle for continuing to feel safe using its cruise control.

title: The Rolling Stones announce new 'Sixty' tour
description: The Rolling Stones are still rocking hard.

title: Ford will start shipping Explorers without all the parts — and add them later
description: The auto industry has a saying: You can't build a car with 99% of the parts. But the computer chip shortage is proving that adage wrong.

title: Russia is trying to install pro-Kremlin officials in occupied cities, but Ukrainians are fighting back
description: Russia is facing new forms of resistance in the cities it has seized in Ukraine, where attempts to abduct and replace political leaders have been met with legal pushback and defiant public protests.

title: Justice Clarence Thomas' wife acknowledges she attended Trump's Jan. 6 rally
description: Conservative activist Virginia "Ginni" Thomas said in an interview published Monday that although she attended a rally on January 6, 2021, she "played no role" in planning the events that day and that she doesn't involve her husband, Supreme Court Justice Clarence Thomas, in the political work she does pushing conservative causes.

title: Interested in environmentally and socially conscious investing? Here's what you need to know
description: Climate change. Inequality. Unrest. There's a lot to consider in today's world and you may find yourself wanting to invest only in companies that aim to do business in an environmentally sustainable, socially equitable and ethical way.

title: Iran's strike on Iraq puts US in awkward position amid nuclear talks
description: The United States appears to be keen to tell the world that it wasn't the target of Iranian missile strikes in Iraq on Sunday.

title: US economy flashes a recession warning sign
description: Surging oil and gas prices have raised recession alarm bells around the world. But another economic indicator is starting to look ominous: The yield curve is flattening.

title: 'We will stay here. We will fight': The women in a sleepy border town refusing to leave Ukraine
Russia could default on its debt within days
Pete Davidson and five paying customers to fly on Jeff Bezos' suborbital rocket
description: Pete Davidson will become the latest celebrity to fly to space with Jeff Bezos' rocket company, Blue Origin, in a brief, suborbital flight slated for later this month.

title: The 47 wildest lines from Donald Trump's South Carolina speech
description: Donald Trump traveled to Florence, South Carolina, over the weekend to deliver the latest in a series of campaign-style speeches as he hints at running for president again in 2024.

title: Tough to maintain healthy food habits? Shift to these weekly goals
description: Going 100% vegan, cutting carbs or attempting to lose 30 pounds quickly is daunting, drastic and difficult to sustain. And such lofty goals may not be healthy choices for you.

title: The command center on rails: How Ukrainians are keeping trains on track in war
description: A muffled sound cuts through the dim room enveloped in long, dark curtains. A  Soviet-era closed-circuit phone system blares a message in Ukrainian to six men, half of whom are dressed in military green. But they're not military men, they're the executives of Ukrainian Railways.

title: Another Champions League meltdown, star players booed and rumored departures: What next for PSG?
description: Even by Paris Saint-Germain's standards, the past week has been an eventful one.

title: Republican donors line up behind Liz Cheney as she takes on Trump
description: Bobbie and Bill Kilberg were expecting a few dozen people for their fundraiser Monday for GOP Rep. Liz Cheney, an intimate cocktail party they were planning at their home in McLean, Virginia.

title: Pies around the world -- sweet and savory pastries to celebrate Pi Day
description: March 14 is Pi Day in honor of the first three digits of the mathematical constant π (3.1415...). But it's also a flimsy, yet delicious, excuse to celebrate an enduring culinary concept: the many edible varieties of pie around the world.

title: Ethiopia pledges action after video shows uniformed men burning civilians alive
description: Ethiopia's government said on Saturday it would act against the perpetrators after a video appeared on social media showing armed men, some in military uniforms, burning civilians to death in the country's west.

title: Adele has another concert special coming
description: Adele went home and recorded another concert special.

title: Zelensky pressed Biden for more sanctions during their latest call
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky pressed US President Joe Biden during their latest call for more sanctions to further squeeze Russia, CNN has learned.

title: Covid-19 cases continue to rise in China's worst outbreak since Wuhan
Tom Brady's 'final' career touchdown ball sells for over $518,000 at auction
description: Tom Brady's 'final' career touchdown ball has sold for $518,000 at auction, according to the auction site Lelands.

title: Three women, one airplane journey, and an unexpected friendship
description: Regina Dew was one of the first passengers to board the Southwest Airlines flight from Phoenix, Arizona to Baltimore, Maryland.

title: Shane Lowry hits hole-in-one on 'one of the most iconic holes in golf' at the Players Championship
description: If you watch Shane Lowry play golf, he's sure to eventually make you get out of your seat.

title: Brittney Griner: 'It's the most audacious hostage taking by a state imaginable,' says former captive
description: When Jonathan Franks first heard that the American basketball star Brittney Griner had been detained in Russia, his initial sense was one of disbelief.

title: Gravity could solve renewable energy's biggest problem
description: In the Swiss municipality of Arbedo-Castione, a 70-meter crane stands tall. Six arms protrude from the top, hoisting giant blocks into the sky. But these aren't building blocks, and the crane isn't being used for construction.

title: Climbers hold world's highest tea party on Mount Everest
description: High Tea took on a whole new meaning for Andrew Hughes and his climbing crew.

title: BAFTAs 2022: Best fashion on the red carpet
description: The ongoing invasion of Ukraine hung over proceedings at the 75th British Academy Film Awards (BAFTAs) on Sunday, with organizers offering words of support and host Rebel Wilson using the spotlight to aim a middle finger at Russian president Vladimir Putin.

title: Shocking video shows Russian tank firing on an apartment building
description: CNN's Pamela Brown reports on Russia's "brutal and unrelenting" assault on Ukraine, showing video of Russian tanks firing on a Ukrainian apartment building.

title: See waterspout fly across Florida beach
description: Beachgoers ran for safety after a tornado-like waterspout emerged from the ocean at Fort Myers Beach.
